## SingleConnectionPool class

Not really a pool implementation. Uses one and only pool-object, but behaves like a pool.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class SingleConnectionPool<T extends Poolable> extends PoolBase<T> implements AbstractPool<T> 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [PoolBase](./ystd.poolbase.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

<b>Implements:</b> [AbstractPool](./ystd.abstractpool.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(settings)](./ystd.singleconnectionpool._constructor_.md) |  | Creates a new SingleConnectionPool<T> Not really a pool. Always uses just one pool-object. The pool-object is created on the first get() |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [close(forced)](./ystd.singleconnectionpool.close.md) |  | Closes all corresponding pool-objects and the pool |
|  [get()](./ystd.singleconnectionpool.get.md) |  | Obtains a pool-object from pool. If no free DbClients available a new one will be created. If connectionLimit is reached - will wait for a free pool-object.<!-- -->UNSAFE! Better use exec(callback) |
